base_note.note_text:
BRONCHIAL THERMOPLASTY NOTE
Date: 2025-07-20
Patient: Sandra Lewis | MRN: 3404046 | Age: 48F
Attending: Dr. Andrew Miller, MD
Location: National Jewish Health, Denver, CO

INDICATION: Severe persistent asthma (FEV1 65%, on high-dose ICS/LABA, omalizumab, history of 3 exacerbations past year). Selected for bronchial thermoplasty after multidisciplinary review.

PROCEDURE: Bronchial thermoplasty - Session 2 of 3 (Left Lower Lobe)

ANESTHESIA: Moderate sedation

PROCEDURE DETAILS:
Using the Alair System (Boston Scientific), bronchial thermoplasty performed in the left lower lobe.

Treatment Sites:
- LB6: 15 activations
- LB7: 8 activations
- LB8: 12 activations
- LB9: 14 activations
- LB10: 11 activations

Total activations: 60

Each activation delivered radiofrequency energy at 18.5 watts for 10 seconds at sequential 5mm intervals per standard protocol.

POST-PROCEDURE: Patient observed for 4 hours. Mild transient chest tightness resolved with bronchodilator. No significant adverse events.

PLAN: Session 3 (RLL) in 3 weeks.

Dr. Andrew Miller, MD

code_rationales.31660: Bronchial thermoplasty, single lobe (LLL). Standard 3-session protocol.

coding_review.overall_assessment: BT session 2 of 3 for severe asthma.

changes: Populated registry_entry.billing from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 for CPT codes 31660; total_work_rvu=4.0, total_rvu=5.97 (facility).

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY PROCEDURE DOCUMENTATION
============================================================

PATIENT IDENTIFICATION AND DEMOGRAPHICS
----------------------------------------
Patient: Justin Morgan
Medical Record Number: 1291247
Date of Birth: N/A
Age at Procedure: N/A years
Procedure Date: 2024-02-06

CLINICAL INDICATION AND PREOPERATIVE ASSESSMENT
----------------------------------------
The patient presented with severe persistent asthma - bt session 2. Following comprehensive multidisciplinary evaluation and informed consent discussion detailing procedural risks, benefits, and alternatives, the patient elected to proceed with the proposed intervention.

PROCEDURAL METHODOLOGY AND TECHNIQUE
----------------------------------------

Bronchial Thermoplasty:


INTRAPROCEDURAL FINDINGS
----------------------------------------
Detailed airway examination was performed with findings as documented in the procedural narrative.


POSTPROCEDURAL ASSESSMENT AND DISPOSITION
----------------------------------------
The procedure was completed without immediate complications. The patient demonstrated hemodynamic stability throughout and was transferred to the recovery area in satisfactory condition.

PROCEDURAL CODING DOCUMENTATION
----------------------------------------
Current Procedural Terminology Codes: 31660

This documentation has been prepared in accordance with institutional standards for procedural documentation and coding compliance.

PROCEDURE NOTE

Date: 2024-06-18
Patient: Emma Wang
MRN: 4181473
Age/Sex: Noneyo patient

Attending Physician: [Attending]
Resident/Fellow: [Trainee, PGY-X]

INDICATION:
Severe persistent asthma - BT Session 2

CONSENT:
Informed consent obtained. Risks, benefits, and alternatives discussed.
Patient verbalized understanding and agreed to proceed.

TIMEOUT:
Performed. Correct patient, procedure, and site confirmed.

SEDATION:
Moderate

PROCEDURE STEPS:
1. Patient positioned and monitored
2. Sedation administered per protocol
3. Topical anesthesia applied to airway
4. Bronchial Thermoplasty performed
5. Scope withdrawn
6. Patient recovered without complication

SPECIMENS:
As documented above

COMPLICATIONS:
None

EBL:
Minimal

DISPOSITION:
To recovery, stable condition

CPT CODES: 31660

ATTESTATION:
I was present for the entire procedure and agree with the above documentation.
[Attending Signature]

variations.note_text:
On 2024-07-25, Kimberly Castillo, a None-year-old patient (MRN 1294707), underwent bronchoscopic evaluation for Severe persistent asthma - BT Session 2. The patient received Moderate and the procedure was performed in standard fashion. The procedure included bronchial thermoplasty. 

On examination, the airways were systematically inspected. The procedure was completed without immediate complications. 

The patient tolerated the procedure well and was transferred to the recovery area in stable condition. Specimens obtained were sent for appropriate analysis and results will be reviewed at follow-up. The preliminary assessment is asthma. 

Procedural coding: 31660.
